items.title: Khrushchev's great-granddaughter weighs in on proposed Russia-Ukraine peace plan
items.standfirst: Nina Khrushcheva, professor in the Julien J. Studley Graduate Programs of International Affairs at the New School and great-granddaughter of former Soviet leader Nikita Khrushchev, joins CBS News 24/7 to discuss the Trump administration's proposed 28-point peace plan to end the Russia-Ukraine war.
items.content: Nina Khrushcheva, professor in the Julien J. Studley Graduate Programs of International Affairs at the New School and great-granddaughter of former Soviet leader Nikita Khrushchev, joins CBS News 24/7 to discuss the Trump administration's proposed 28-point peace plan to end the Russia-Ukraine war.

items.title: Putin says U.S. plan for Ukraine could form the basis for a final peace settlement

items.content: The plan includes many of Russian President Vladimir Putin's demands. Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Friday that his country is at "truly one of the most difficult moments in our history."(Image credit: Kateryna Klochko)

items.title: Zelenskyy says Ukraine faces most difficult moment as Trump pushes plan to end war
items.standfirst: US president presses Kyiv to accept plan that would mean giving up territory to RussiaVolodymyr Zelenskyy has said Ukraine faces one of the most difficult moments in its history, as Donald Trump demanded Kyiv accepts within days a US-backed “peace plan” that would force it to give up territory to Russia and to make other painful concessions.Trump confirmed on Friday morning that next Thursday – Thanksgiving in the US – would be an “acceptable” deadline for Zelenskyy to sign the deal, which European and Ukrainian officials have warned amounts to a “capitulation”. Continue reading...

items.title: How key players reacted to US plan to end war in Ukraine
items.standfirst: European leaders and UN officials voiced unease on Friday over a new US proposal to end the war in Ukraine, warning that Washington’s plan risked sidelining Kyiv and its allies. The 28-point plan calls for major concessions by Ukraine, including giving up a part of its eastern territory.
items.content: European leaders and UN officials voiced unease on Friday over a new US proposal to end the war in Ukraine, warning that Washington’s plan risked sidelining Kyiv and its allies. The 28-point plan calls for major concessions by Ukraine, including giving up a part of its eastern territory.

items.title: Volodymyr Zelensky faces an impossible dilemma for Ukraine
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky is being pushed into a stark dilemma: accept the controversial US-backed peace plan — widely seen as overwhelmingly favourable to Russia — or risk being accused of rejecting peace and undermining Washington’s diplomatic efforts. President Donald Trump is now increasing pressure on Zelensky to endorse the proposal, leaving Kyiv with little room to manoeuvre, as FRANCE 24's Gulliver Cragg explains from Kyiv.
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky is being pushed into a stark dilemma: accept the controversial US-backed peace plan — widely seen as overwhelmingly favourable to Russia — or risk being accused of rejecting peace and undermining Washington’s diplomatic efforts. President Donald Trump is now increasing pressure on Zelensky to endorse the proposal, leaving Kyiv with little room to manoeuvre, as FRANCE 24's Gulliver Cragg explains from Kyiv.

items.title: Here's what's in Trump administration's proposed Russia-Ukraine peace plan
items.standfirst: Trump administration officials have proposed a 28-point peace plan designed to end the Russia-Ukraine war — a framework that would require Ukraine to give up territory and swear off NATO membership.
items.content: Trump administration officials have proposed a 28-point peace plan designed to end the Russia-Ukraine war — a framework that would require Ukraine to give up territory and swear off NATO membership.

items.title: Vance and Zelenskyy discuss concerning 28-point peace plan that may favor Russia
items.standfirst: Vice President JD Vance and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy held a call on Friday to discuss the U.S. proposal of a 28-point peace plan to end the war with Russia. CBS News' Ed O'Keefe reports, and Nina Khrushcheva, a professor of international affairs at the New School, joins CBS News with more insight.
items.content: Vice President JD Vance and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy held a call on Friday to discuss the U.S. proposal of a 28-point peace plan to end the war with Russia. CBS News' Ed O'Keefe reports, and Nina Khrushcheva, a professor of international affairs at the New School, joins CBS News with more insight.

items.title: Ukraine risks ‘losing a key partner’ with Trump’s peace proposal, Zelensky says
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said Friday that he would not betray Ukraine's interests in a US-led peace process, warning that Kyiv faces a choice between safeguarding its dignity and risking a rupture with Washington. The 28-point plan the United States presented to Kyiv was laden with Russian demands, including Ukrainian territorial concessions.
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said Friday that he would not betray Ukraine's interests in a US-led peace process, warning that Kyiv faces a choice between safeguarding its dignity and risking a rupture with Washington. The 28-point plan the United States presented to Kyiv was laden with Russian demands, including Ukrainian territorial concessions.

items.standfirst: The US-brokered proposal requires Kyiv to make territorial concessions to Russia and to stay out of NATO.
items.content: The US-brokered proposal requires Kyiv to make territorial concessions to Russia and to stay out of NATO.

items.title: Trump urges Ukraine to accept plan after Zelenskyy warns he could lose U.S. support
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump said Friday that he wants Ukraine to accept a new peace deal by Thanksgiving, after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warned the deal was forcing his country to choose between its “dignity” and a “key partner.”The White House wants Kyiv to sign off on a “framework” to end the war in Ukraine based upon the U.S.-crafted 28-point peace plan by Thursday, according to three U.S. officials
items.content: President Donald Trump said Friday that he wants Ukraine to accept a new peace deal by Thanksgiving, after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warned the deal was forcing his country to choose between its “dignity” and a “key partner.”The White House wants Kyiv to sign off on a “framework” to end the war in Ukraine based upon the U.S.-crafted 28-point peace plan by Thursday, according to three U.S. officials

items.title: Trump's 28-point Ukraine peace plan in full
items.standfirst: Donald Trump's plan for ending the war in Ukraine would hand swathes of land to Russia and limit the size of Kyiv's military, a draft has revealed.
items.content: Donald Trump's plan for ending the war in Ukraine would hand swathes of land to Russia and limit the size of Kyiv's military, a draft has revealed.

ai_summary: Zelenskyy says Ukraine faces a difficult moment regarding the US peace plan.
Trump set a Thanksgiving deadline for Ukraine to accept the US-backed plan.
The plan may force Ukraine to give up territory to Russia.
Zelenskyy is talking with allies about the proposed peace plan.
Khrushcheva discussed the peace plan on CBS News 24/7.

clusters.title: Grizzly bear attacks group of students and teachers in western Canada
clusters.neutral_headline: Grizzly Bear Attacks School Group in Canada

items.title: Grizzly bear attacks group of students and teachers in western Canada
items.standfirst: Several people were injured when a grizzly bear attacked a school group in a remote community on British Columbia's Central Coast, officials said.
items.content: Several people were injured when a grizzly bear attacked a school group in a remote community on British Columbia's Central Coast, officials said.

items.title: Eleven injured after grizzly bear attacks schoolchildren and teachers in Canada
items.standfirst: Two critically hurt after attack on walking trail in British Columbia as police and conservation officers search for bearEleven people were injured, two of them critically, when a grizzly bear attacked a group of schoolchildren and teachers on a walking trail in British Columbia, Canada.The attack happened on Thursday in Bella Coola, 435 miles (700km) north-west of Vancouver. The Nuxalk Nation said the “aggressive bear” remained on the loose and police and conservation officers were on the scene. Continue reading...
items.content: Two critically hurt after attack on walking trail in British Columbia as police and conservation officers search for bearEleven people were injured, two of them critically, when a grizzly bear attacked a group of schoolchildren and teachers on a walking trail in British Columbia, Canada.The attack happened on Thursday in Bella Coola, 435 miles (700km) north-west of Vancouver. The Nuxalk Nation said the “aggressive bear” remained on the loose and police and conservation officers were on the scene. Continue reading...

items.title: Grizzly bear on loose after attacking school group in Canada, injuring 11
items.standfirst: A male teacher "got the whole brunt" of the attack and some children were hit with bear spray.
items.content: A male teacher "got the whole brunt" of the attack and some children were hit with bear spray.

items.title: Two critically injured after grizzly bear attacks schoolchildren
items.standfirst: A grizzly bear attack on a group of schoolchildren and teachers in Canada has injured 11 people, two of them critically.
items.content: A grizzly bear attack on a group of schoolchildren and teachers in Canada has injured 11 people, two of them critically.

ai_summary: A grizzly bear attacked a school group in British Columbia, Canada.
Eleven people were injured, with two critically injured in the attack.
The attack occurred on a walking trail near Bella Coola.
Police and conservation officers are searching for the bear.
A male teacher was severely injured in the attack.

clusters.title: Mamdani set to meet with President Trump at White House today

items.title: Mamdani set to meet with President Trump at White House today
items.standfirst: New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani is set to meet with President Trump on Friday afternoon, where he plans to discuss affordability​.
items.content: New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani is set to meet with President Trump on Friday afternoon, where he plans to discuss affordability​.

items.title: Trump and Mamdani set for Oval Office face-off
items.standfirst: Meeting marks the first in-person meeting between the US president and New York City’s mayor-elect
items.content: Meeting marks the first in-person meeting between the US president and New York City’s mayor-elect

items.title: The stakes behind Zohran Mamdani and Donald Trump’s first face-to-face
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump is about to meet New York mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani on Friday, their first face-to-face after trading insults for weeks. Mamdani requested the meeting to discuss living costs and public safety, while Trump has threatened to cut federal funding to the city and branded the 34-year-old democratic socialist a 'radical left lunatic'. FRANCE 24's international editor Douglas Herbert analyses the stakes of this first meeting.
items.content: President Donald Trump is about to meet New York mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani on Friday, their first face-to-face after trading insults for weeks. Mamdani requested the meeting to discuss living costs and public safety, while Trump has threatened to cut federal funding to the city and branded the 34-year-old democratic socialist a 'radical left lunatic'. FRANCE 24's international editor Douglas Herbert analyses the stakes of this first meeting.

items.title: What Trump and Mamdani have said about each other
items.standfirst: President Trump has called Zohran Mamdani "my little communist mayor." Mamdani has vowed to "Trump-proof" New York City. Today they meet at the White House.
items.content: President Trump has called Zohran Mamdani "my little communist mayor." Mamdani has vowed to "Trump-proof" New York City. Today they meet at the White House.

items.title: What to expect as Trump prepares to meet NYC Mayor-elect Mamdani
items.standfirst: President Trump is meeting with New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani at the White House on Friday after a tense election. CBS News' Ed O'Keefe reports.
items.content: President Trump is meeting with New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani at the White House on Friday after a tense election. CBS News' Ed O'Keefe reports.

items.title: CDC claims vaccines may cause autism. And, Trump and Mamdani to meet today
items.standfirst: The CDC claims, without evidence, that vaccines may cause autism. And, New York City mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani heads to the White House, where he will meet the president for the first time.
items.content: The CDC claims, without evidence, that vaccines may cause autism. And, New York City mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani heads to the White House, where he will meet the president for the first time.(Image credit: Elijah Nouvelage)

items.title: New York mayor Zohran Mamdani to meet Donald Trump at the White House
items.standfirst: Incoming New York mayor Zohran Mamdani will meet President Donald Trump at the White House after a heated exchange of insults, with Mamdani calling Trump a “fascist” and Trump calling him a “communist lunatic.” Despite clashes, both show some willingness to cooperate, amid Trump’s threats to cut federal funding and deploy the National Guard in Democrat-run cities.
items.content: Incoming New York mayor Zohran Mamdani will meet President Donald Trump at the White House after a heated exchange of insults, with Mamdani calling Trump a “fascist” and Trump calling him a “communist lunatic.” Despite clashes, both show some willingness to cooperate, amid Trump’s threats to cut federal funding and deploy the National Guard in Democrat-run cities.

ai_summary: New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani will meet President Trump.
The meeting is the first face-to-face between the two.
Mamdani requested the meeting to discuss affordability.
Trump has called Mamdani a "communist lunatic."
The CDC claimed, without evidence, vaccines may cause autism.

items.title: Nigeria reels after second mass school abduction in a week
items.standfirst: Students taken from Catholic school in Niger state amid threats from Trump to intervene over ‘Christian genocide’Unknown gunmen have abducted an unidentified number of students from a Catholic school in central Nigeria, the second mass abduction in the country in a week.The latest kidnapping, in Papiri community in Niger state, came against the backdrop of Donald Trump’s threat to intervene militarily to end a “Christian genocide”, which the Nigerian government has denied is happening. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Bureau of Labor Statistics cancels October inflation report due to shutdown
clusters.neutral_headline: October Inflation Report Canceled Due to Shutdown

items.title: Bureau of Labor Statistics cancels October inflation report due to shutdown
items.standfirst: The Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) announced Friday that it would not produce its highly anticipated monthly inflation report for October after being unable to collect key data during the government shutdown. BLS said it will not release an update to the consumer price index (CPI) for October…
items.content: The Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) announced Friday that it would not produce its highly anticipated monthly inflation report for October after being unable to collect key data during the government shutdown. BLS said it will not release an update to the consumer price index (CPI) for October…

items.title: US data agency cancels October inflation report as Fed considers whether to cut rates
items.standfirst: Bureau of Labor Statistics canceled release of October’s consumer price index, citing the government shutdownThe US federal government will not publish official data on inflation for October, depriving policymakers at the Federal Reserve of key information as they consider whether to cut interest rates.The Bureau of Labor Statistics canceled the release of the closely watched consumer price index (CPI) for October, citing the government shutdown – the longest in history, before it ended earlier this month – and stating it could not “retroactively collect” the data required for the report. Continue reading...
items.content: Bureau of Labor Statistics canceled release of October’s consumer price index, citing the government shutdownThe US federal government will not publish official data on inflation for October, depriving policymakers at the Federal Reserve of key information as they consider whether to cut interest rates.The Bureau of Labor Statistics canceled the release of the closely watched consumer price index (CPI) for October, citing the government shutdown – the longest in history, before it ended earlier this month – and stating it could not “retroactively collect” the data required for the report. Continue reading...

ai_summary: The Bureau of Labor Statistics canceled the October inflation report.
The cancellation was due to the government shutdown.
The BLS could not collect key data for the report.
The Federal Reserve will be without key inflation data.
The shutdown was the longest in US history.

items.title: Biafran separatist leader sentenced to life on terrorism charges by Nigerian court
items.standfirst: Judge says Nnamdi Kanu used his Indigenous People of Biafra group to incite attacks on security officials and civiliansThe Biafran separatist leader Nnamdi Kanu has been sentenced to life in prison on terrorism-related charges by a court in the Nigerian capital, Abuja.Judge James Omotosho said prosecutors had shown that Kanu, who also holds British citizenship, had used his Indigenous People of Biafra group (Ipob) to incite attacks on security officials and civilians in south-east Nigeria and during anti-police protests in Lagos. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

Kanu is a leader of the Biafran separatist movement.

clusters.title: U.S. retiree freed after years jailed in Saudi Arabia for critical tweets
clusters.neutral_headline: Saudi Arabia releases US retiree jailed over critical tweets

items.title: U.S. retiree freed after years jailed in Saudi Arabia for critical tweets
items.standfirst: A U.S. retiree held in Saudi Arabia over critical tweets has been freed months ahead of schedule, his son said, a day after Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman appeared hand in hand with President Donald Trump at the White House."Our family is overjoyed that, after four long years, our father, Saad Almadi, is finally on his way home," his family said in a statement his son Ibrahim posted Wednesday on X. Riyadh authorities jailed and then banned Saad Almadi, 75, from leaving the country two years ag
items.content: A U.S. retiree held in Saudi Arabia over critical tweets has been freed months ahead of schedule, his son said, a day after Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman appeared hand in hand with President Donald Trump at the White House."Our family is overjoyed that, after four long years, our father, Saad Almadi, is finally on his way home," his family said in a statement his son Ibrahim posted Wednesday on X. Riyadh authorities jailed and then banned Saad Almadi, 75, from leaving the country two years ag

items.title: Saudi Arabia releases US retiree jailed over critical tweets
items.standfirst: Saad Almadi’s family thanks Trump and state department as announcement comes after meeting with crown princeSaudi Arabia has agreed to allow US citizen Saad Almadi to return home to Florida, five months ahead of the scheduled lifting of travel restrictions and a day after Saudi crown prince and prime minister Mohammed bin Salman met Donald Trump at the White House.Almadi, 75, was sentenced to 19 years of incarceration in the kingdom in 2021 after he wrote 14 tweets critical of the Riyadh government. Two years later, the charges were reduced to so-called “cyber crimes” and he was sentenced to a 30-year ban on leaving Saudi Arabia. Continue reading...
items.content: Saad Almadi’s family thanks Trump and state department as announcement comes after meeting with crown princeSaudi Arabia has agreed to allow US citizen Saad Almadi to return home to Florida, five months ahead of the scheduled lifting of travel restrictions and a day after Saudi crown prince and prime minister Mohammed bin Salman met Donald Trump at the White House.Almadi, 75, was sentenced to 19 years of incarceration in the kingdom in 2021 after he wrote 14 tweets critical of the Riyadh government. Two years later, the charges were reduced to so-called “cyber crimes” and he was sentenced to a 30-year ban on leaving Saudi Arabia. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Saad Almadi, a US retiree, was released from Saudi prison.
He was jailed for tweets critical of the Saudi government.
His release came months ahead of schedule.
The release followed a meeting with Donald Trump.
Almadi was sentenced to 19 years in 2021.
